author: megasquallers
title: Perma-music rmNFT Marketplace
description: Musicians and Cardano lack a versatile music marketplace which permanently locks original files and gives musicians access to this market

f6_assessments.q0:
This great proposal is within the challenge goal, because I think this implementation will be a need for the Cardano improvement and adoption from end users and it will help many people to increase their participation in consuming NFT on Cardano marketplace and increase transactions volume on blockchain (The music world is a billion dollar industry)
The proposal is the second part of the platform which proposer want develop a marketplace for music NFTs, called Rythmeet (rm)NFTs. 
This proposal is clear and concrete and will contain the minting feature as open source to help the development of other projects/platforms from this challenge, furthermore the project bridge new platform with other projects from the community to help each other develop, and thery are planning to do with PanDAO.
This is an important proposal to attract many new users to the Cardano ecosystem while using music ecosystem, because more than just targeting people already using crypto, the Rythmeet project seeks to bring thousands of people from outside the crypto bubble into the Cardano community.
The proposal clearly articulates the contest, the problem, the challenge and how it will add value to the Cardano ecosystem and for all of the stakeholders..
f6_assessments.q1:
This proposal is well written and clearly demonstrate the experience and the team's commitment.
There are links in the proposal and attached cv, which allowed me to verify the project manager and the other team mmbers and their credentials. 
The scope of the solution is well explained (e.g. how the funds will be spent, what features will be implemented, and so on…) and there are 13 weeks of work for the first launch. There is a too simple cost worksheet, that doesn’t contain all costs (eg. Infrastructure, cloud license, etc.)
The proposers have not mentioned some potential challenges and how they plan on solving them.
f6_assessments.q2:
The auditability here is very good, because the author of the proposal outlines some KPIs that serve to monitor the direct results of the platform developed and a section that contain SDG Rating:
The way to misure success is based on adoption from people, but in my opinion the KPI and SDG suggested are very wide and complex to analyze.
If both funds for part 1(platform that seeks to attract and bring everyone with interest in music for playing, meeting other musicians, finding a place where to perform or even funding scholarships for music students) and part 2 (this proposal marketplace) are accepted within this Fund#8, the proposer will develop both parts at the same time and complete the platform.
Also the proposer has not mentioned possible difficulties about market competitors.

f6_assessments.q0: The proposer is suggesting a music platform that gives access to musicians to put their music as well as mint, sell and lock their original work, in anticipation to a clearly stated lack of such a unique marketplace. The goals and metrics of the proposal are well aligned with those addressed in the challenge.  The proposal integrates a utility on cardano ecosystem, it will attract users, and it is scalable and expandable.
f6_assessments.q1: The team suggested to implement the project is fully qualified and with experience.  There are  enough experts to pull through the project. The proposer has provided a detailed cv of each team member. The timeframe of 6 months might be a little ambitious.  There are a number of tasks to be implemented until the platform is fully set up and running (maybe a couple of more weeks could help refining - just my opinion).  The budget is appropriate for all tasks.  What is unclear to me though is how to market the platform? How it will get known to musicians? This is a feasible project with a good team to implement it, but it needs to be known to people so that they can use it, therefore I suggest that the proposer and the team come up with a clear marketing plan to promote this wonderful platform.
f6_assessments.q2: The milestones are clearly stated and are measurable with numbers of users, number of mintings, updates on githum, twitter, telegram and instangram.  The proposer has made clear the possible challenges encountered while implementing the project and gave solutions which are logical and feasible. I feel confident that the team can implement the project with success and benefit the cardano ecosystem.

f6_assessments.q0: This project implements smart contracts and NFTs using Cardano solutions for the music industry. The application of NFTs in the music industry is practical since Cardano is secured and efficient. As explained in the proposal, this project will lift the barriers met by musicians and music buyers, increasing the productivity of this million dollars worth industry. I think this proposal has done more than just address this challenge of DApps and Integration.
f6_assessments.q1: The team members have experience in the music industry and the technology field. I think they have the foundation to run this business, given the skills they presented in this proposal. However, although the presenter mentions learning about the competitors, the proposal does not explain this project's "secret sauce" - competitive advantages. I am little aware of this aspect because the application of NFTs in the art industry is not new, and there may be other projects with a similar solution.
f6_assessments.q2: I think the presenter has done a great job formulating this proposal. I have almost everything to audit the success of this project. The timeline and budget breakdown are highly applicable and reasonable. However, the budget breakdown only mentions the cost of human resources. To run a business like this, there are a lot more costs like marketing, operating, systems maintenance, etc. I think the team should come up with a more well-thought-out money allocation.

f6_assessments.q0:
Music content creators frequently complain that the way the industry is structured hurts them because the compensation model is unfair, and it is often well known that their creativity can be compromised by the commercial interests of the record label.
The proponent has identified a market that I believe may become the next trend in the NFT ecosystem due to the utility they provide.
If a platform can be effectively developed that provides creators with the necessary tools to market their creations without the need for intermediaries, potentially an artist with an established network of followers could market their releases without the need for record labels.
Due to its low transaction costs as well as the possibility to send several assets in a single transaction, Cardano becomes an excellent platform to develop this type of solution.
f6_assessments.q1:
Although the proposer's experience is broad and with numerous achievements in its field, it does not necessarily relate to the concepts described in this proposal. This does not constitute a significant obstacle due to his proven ability to lead succesful projects, in addition to being accompanied by an outsourced team with extensive experience in the development of applications and software.
However, if the proposal is successful, it will need much more than a good Dapp because it will participate in a market that seeks to break heavy structures of the world of music and its operation.
The proponent understands this problem well, and although the project is in its early stages of development, it is possible to create the described platform to host the artists who see in Cardano, a launchpad for their projects.
In my opinion, the biggest challenge of this project will be to gain traction among artists as well as the consumer public, and that is why I would have liked to see in the proposal a thorough marketing plan or some partnerships already in place for the launch of the platform, as well as adressing  the importance on socials to get the ball rolling. 
I understand that there is a complementary proposal but if only this one gets funded, it should be able to guarantee sustainability on its own.
In summary, I believe that everything described is technically achievable by the team, however making this economic model reach the masses will be a task that cannot be measured within this proposal.
f6_assessments.q2:
The KPI's and milestones are clear and would allow clear monitoring of the project's objectives and achievements, as they are well defined.
On the other hand I consider that if approved, this project should establish a communication channel with the community in order to have a more direct communication, maybe participating in some Townhalls whwnever therés some milestone to watch. 
The means provided to follow up on the results are social accounts that were created just a few days ago, including the proponent's account. It is understandable that perhaps they do not want to mix private life and prefer a fresh start for the socials of this project, however this does not allow to make a proper idea during the due diligence, as there are no interactions or relationships to serve as a reference.
Last but not least, the proponent does a good job in identifying the compatibility of this project with the SDGs, adressing 3 of them directly, as well as the subgoals derived from them.

solution: Our platform Rythmeet will allow musicians to network, mint and sell their creations through NFTs and permanently lock their original files
experience:
Proposer: 2 PhDs, 8 years in research and international project management

Team: 30 years cumulated in software development and project management
